result.execSummary:
The defendant Roger Donald Padgett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Roger Donald Padgett is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Roger Donald Padgett was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roger Donald Padgett

defendant.name: Padgett, Roger Donald

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Roger Donald Padgett in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant paid amount in full.  State gives recommendation.  Defendant agrees.  Waives right to an attorney today.    No contest plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Def. guilty.  Court imposes sentence.
Count 2:
$243.00 fine/costs and $200.00 DNA surcharge, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.  PAID
DNA sample.
Paperwork handed in court.
Count 1: Dismissed.

Defendant Roger Donald Padgett in court.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE waives counsel and states he accepted the plea but hasn't been able to pay off the forfeiture yet as needed.  Requests 30 day extension.  State responds but thinks they should press ahead w/a plea at this time even if it's not guilty.  Court explains the procedure to the DE.  State notes they have no intention to withdraw the plea offer until at least the FPT date is here.  Advises DE to contact the DA's office as soon as he's completed what he needs to do.  DE pleads not guilty.  Court enters Not Guilty plea- Set for Trial.  Bond continued.

Defendant Roger Donald Padgett in court.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes DE requested 60 days in June to meet some conditions.  DE explains what he's been doing for the last 60 days.  Requests another 60 days.  State clarifies statement by DE as to a plea to Ct 2 w/costs of $443.00 to be paid prior to the plea.  DE responds.  Court resets.  Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Roger Donald Padgett in court.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states DE needed to pay $443.00 to COC's office prior to agreement being reached.  DE explains why he hasn't done so.  Requests more time/90 days.  State agrees to reset of 60 days.  Court resets two months.  Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference at 05-29-2015 09:45 am.
Return date at 06-10-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Roger Donald Padgett in court.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint. Advised rights to an attorney, waived today only.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $350.00 Signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Booking today  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 09:45 am.  Return date scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
